headline.print_headline: Where Children Discover Their Inner Child
headline.main: Where Children Discover Their Inner Child

docs.abstract: Children's Museum of Manhattan opens show EatSleepPlay: Building Health Every Day, which teaches children about health in ways that can be visceral but also playful and easy to understand.
docs.lead_paragraph: The mission of “EatSleepPlay: Building Health Every Day,” the new show at the Children’s Museum of Manhattan, is to teach children about health in ways that can be visceral but also playful and easy to understand.
docs.snippet: The mission of “EatSleepPlay: Building Health Every Day,” the new show at the Children’s Museum of Manhattan, is to teach children about health in ways that can be visceral but also playful and easy to understand.

headline.main: At a Big Church, a Small Group Health Solution

docs.abstract: A weight-loss program at Saddleback Church provides the small-group support its members need to maintain healthier lifestyles.
docs.lead_paragraph: About a year ago, Rev. Rick Warren, the pastor of Saddleback Church in southern California, was conducting a baptism when he noticed something.   As with everything at this megachurch, with some 30,000 members, baptisms are large events - this time, 858 people were being baptized.  "Along about 500 I thought - this is my honest truth, it wasn't a very spiritual thought - we're all fat," Warren told his congregation later.  "I know pastors aren't supposed to be thinking that when they're baptizing, but that was what I thought: we're all fat.  But I'm fat, and I'm a terrible model of this."
docs.snippet: A weight-loss program at Saddleback Church provides the small-group support its members need to maintain healthier lifestyles.

docs.abstract: With a supercommittee and a “group of four” involved, can a food system be improved?
docs.snippet: With a supercommittee and a “group of four” involved, can a food system be improved?

docs.abstract: With a supercommittee and a "group of four" involved, can a food system be improved?
docs.lead_paragraph: The Republican-manufactured budget crisis of this past summer - remember? - resulted in a "solution" that's hijacking what little representative democratic process we have left. Equally sad is that the so-called supercommittee - charged with creating an outline for reducing the deficit by $1.2 trillion over 10 years - may preclude full discussion of the farm bill.
docs.snippet: With a supercommittee and a "group of four" involved, can a food system be improved?
